intro: Psychotria monopedicellata, commonly known as the single-fruited psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It produces small, red berries that are typically consumed by various bird species. Due to its ecological importance and ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
